p: C. violaceum 026 is often used for screening QSIs. When the C. violaceum 026 CviR receptor is bound by exogenous C6-HSL, violacein expression regulated by the QS system is activated. Phenolic compounds can inhibit the QS system by competitively binding to the CviR receptor, thereby blocking the production of violacein [ 29], Thus, inhibition of C. violaceum 026 violacein production by CFEE must be the result of active QSI molecules. These molecules require identification and further study.
